trans-unit.source: Represents a configuration section that defines the type that the service hosting environment instantiates for a particular transport.
If this section is empty, the default type is used.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Configuration.ServiceHostingEnvironmentSection"></xref> class.
Gets or sets a Boolean value that specifies whether ASP.NET compatibility mode has been enabled for the current application.

When this property is set to `true`, requests to [!INCLUDE[indigo1](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] services flow through the ASP.NET HTTP pipeline and communication over non-HTTP protocols is prohibited.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if ASP.NET compatibility mode has been enabled for the current application; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets a collection of configuration elements that specifies prefix filters for the base addresses used by the service host.
A collection of configuration elements that specifies prefix filters for the base addresses used by the service host.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Configuration.ServiceHostingEnvironmentSection"></xref> closes idle services at low memory.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Configuration.ServiceHostingEnvironmentSection"></xref> closes idle services at low memory; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.

Gets or sets an integer that specifies the minimum amount of free memory that should be available to the system, before a [!INCLUDE[indigo1](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] service can be activated.
An integer that specifies the minimum amount of free memory that should be available to the system, before a [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] service can be activated.
Gets or sets a value that specifies whether multiple IIS bindings per site are enabled.
IIS consists of web sites, which are containers for virtual applications containing virtual directories.
The application in a site can be accessed through one or more IIS binding.
An IIS binding provides two pieces of information: a binding protocol and binding information.
Binding protocol defines the scheme over which communication occurs, and binding information is the information used to access the site.

An example of a binding protocol can be HTTP, whereas binding information can contain an IP address, Port, host header, etc. IIS supports specifying multiple IIS bindings per site, which results in multiple base addresses per scheme.
However, a [!INCLUDE[indigo1](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] service hosted under a site allows binding to only one baseAddress per scheme.
To enable multiple IIS bindings per site for a [!INCLUDE[indigo1](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] service, set this property to `true`.
Notice that multiple site binding is supported only for the HTTP protocol.
The address of endpoints in the configuration file needs to be a complete URI.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if multiple IIS bindings per site are enabled; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
To be added.
Gets a collection of configuration elements that activates a service and can be merged across a hierarchy of configuration files.
A collection of configuration elements that activates a service and can be merged across a hierarchy of configuration files.
Gets a collection of types that implement the specific transport.
A <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Configuration.TransportConfigurationTypeElementCollection"></xref> that contains all the types that implement the specific transport.
